items.subtitle: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 2 October 2023
items.title: Great phone from UR.co.uk
items.review_text:
So I paid around £869 for this you could get it for £830 for the 128gb as of the end of September because the sellers were shaking the prices. The phone has 1000% health and 50 cycles on it. There are few scratches on the buttons but none on the screen or the sides. There is visible dust in the speaker  vents on the top of the screen but it doesn’t bother me that much. The touch responsiveness feels slightly off for now but luckily Amazon has a a long replacement or refund policy so I feel safe. Overall it’s a great phone for the price and feels quite similar to the 15Pro max for a huge discount. The phone was in immaculate condition and the slight scratches that I mentioned are verrrryyyy slight so it’s not noticeable at all if you manage to get this for £800 ish it’s a steal
Edit: I have been using this for 3 weeks and it feels great I have added a spigen screen guard and case to keep this in mint condition but the touch randomly feels non responsive( I have moved from an android device so maybe I’m not used to iOS) will post an update in 6 months

items.subtitle: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 21 September 2023
items.title: Great seller
items.review_text: I’m very particular about buying second hand phones. If it’s described as excellent, I expect it to be just that! So when my order arrived with two scratches on the screen, I returned it! The seller was very good and offered an exchange. Replacement arrived a week later and I’m very impressed. No only is the phone immaculate, the battery health is 100% as well! Very impressed. Seller was SellMyMobile, would definitely recommend.

items.subtitle: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 14 June 2023
items.title: Poor Customer Service & Faulty Product
items.review_text:
I would avoid for two reasons:
1. Poor customer service
2. They sell them without testing them properly.
I'll explain more here...
We ordered the latest iPhone, and it looks like a legitimate deal and trusted by amazon. But unfortunately its dodgy
The phone arrived looking (and sold as) new, but after trying multiple sims in it, it was faulty (despite being unlocked).
As the seller sold it as being completely tested and working, we obviously tried different network sims in it, but nothing worked.
Having taken it finally to an apple store they ran a 3 minute MRI test on it and not only did they find it was a fault phone that doesn't read ANY sim card you put in it, but that this fault was actually part of its history and probably the reason why it was taken back in the first place.
My issue is that the whole thing took weeks to sort, and we were without a phone but on a contract for the whole time. From initially being sent the phone, to trying to find out what's wrong with it, to sending it back and then waiting for them to respond.
The latter part of the customer service was terrible by the seller, they don't work weekends and if we didn't call them would have had no response about refunds etc from them probably. They were also non-remorseful about the situation
This was the first time also that we found Amazon customer service to be terrible, dismissive and rude:
When we told them about the "trusted seller" they literally said "well you should have bought from the official iPhone shop"
There are some great refurb shops online, but this whole service is damaging the idea

Ordered a ‘Refurbished - New’ iPhone 14 Pro Max 256GB, stated delivery would be 2 days however it arrived the following day (less than 15 hours after I ordered it).
The phone looks brand new and has no signs of ever being used, or refurbished.
Excellent service and a great saving versus a ‘new’ one.

Very happy
